intro: Aciphylla colensoi var. maxima, commonly known as the Colenso's aciphylla, is a perennial shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming structure with dense, woolly leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal and subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
